articles.author: Bethany Dawson
articles.title: VIDEO: Trump announces Boeing 757 private jet is back, hints at 2024 run
articles.description: The Boeing 757 was frequently used as a prop for rallies during Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign. It was nicknamed Trump Force One.
articles.content:
As Donald Trump continues to hint at running for the US Presidency in 2024, his son has announced that his VIP Boeing 757 private jet is back after an extensive refit.

articles.author: Ryan Hogg
articles.title: Tesla shares set to rev up after Musk walks away from Twitter: analyst
articles.description: Elon Musk's deal to buy Twitter has been holding back the electric car maker's stock, according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives.
articles.content:
Elon Musk's decision to abandon his takeover bid for Twitter is expected to help Tesla's stock price recover from big losses this year, according to a respected tech analyst.

articles.author: Ryan Hogg
articles.title: Why rising prices may spark more theft, burglaries – and even murders
articles.description: Richard Rosenfeld from the University of Missouri–St Louis says soaring inflation will create more demand for stolen goods.
articles.content:
Soaring inflation threaten to trigger a crime wave, a criminologist says, and your purchases might get caught up along the way.

articles.author: Bethany Dawson
articles.title: Sri Lanka: Protesters storm president's residence in Colombo
articles.description: Protesters stormed the home of Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, in the commercial capital Colombo. The president was moved to safety.
articles.content:
Thousands of protesters in Sri Lanka's commercial capital of Colombo have stormed the presidential residence, according to reports. 
The angry crowds forced President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to flee his … [+1333 chars]

articles.description: The Tesla founder was once a supporter of Joe Biden, but his views changed not long after the President entered the White House.

articles.title: Donald Trump Jr says Twitter got 'busted' for its spam accounts
articles.description: Donald Trump Jr said the number of fake accounts is "probably 50%" and "not 5%" shortly after the Tesla founder abandoned his $44 billion deal.
articles.content:

articles.title: GOP Senator Johnson pulls radio campaign ad after Highland Park shooting
articles.description: Johnson's ad blamed the Biden administration for the deaths of 53 migrants in San Antonio: "Human, sex, and drug trafficking are out of control."
articles.content:

articles.title: Russian aircraft adds 6 hours to flight time to avoid EU airspace
